result.execSummary:
The defendant Bryce G. Mathews was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Imposed and stayed with work release/huber.
Conditions:  Pay for, attend, and successfully complete any educational programs recommended by the agent.  Pay costs.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Franker.  Atty. Franker informs the Court that the parties have reached an agreement for resolution.  DA - states moves for amendment of resisting/obstructing for imposed/stayed jail with probation.  Court allows the amendment.  Def pleads no contest to the charge as amended.

40 days imposed/stayed for 1 year probation.  Conditions:  Pay for, attend, and succ. complete any educational programs as recommended by the agent.  Costs.  0 days credit in the event of revocation.
Status conference on October 22, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

DA Harper, Def, and Atty. Franker.  DA states that the parties are moving towards resolution; discovery is complete; asks for another status as likely resolution.  Status conference scheduled for 10-22-2014 at 02:30 pm.
Status conference on September 17, 2014 at 09:00 am.

ADA Forehand, Def in custody (in custody in Iowa County Jail presently), and Atty. Franker.  Atty. F states def's alternative-to-revocation will be completed on August 13th; def is willing to waive prelim time limits with hopes of speaking with DA Harper; asks for status.  Def has indicated he has an address that's different than on the complaint but doesn't know it - states it's on Highway P - doesn't know the numbers but will provide the information to the clerk, through counsel, after this hearing.  Atty. Franker has asked for status scheduling with prelim time limits only waived at this time.  Status conference scheduled for 09-17-2014 at 09:00 am.
Adjourned initial appearance on July 29, 2014 at 03:30 pm.

DA Harper and Atty. Franker.  DA states that counsel have just learned that def is in the Iowa County Jail; asks for adjournment to Sep.  DA states that def's attendance will be required at the next date.

Atty. Franker states that he has talked with the def and the def would be willing to waive the prelim time limits.  DA is uncertain as to whether time limits can be waived without def's presence.

Adjourned initial set for July 29 at 3:30.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for 07-29-2014 at 03:30 pm.
